description: From New Latin therapeuticus (“curing, healing”), from Ancient Greek θεραπευτικός (therapeutikós, “attentive, helpful, obliging, curative”), from θεραπευτής (therapeutḗs, “one who waits on another, an attendant”), from θεραπεύω (therapeúō, “I wait on, attend, serve, cure”).

adjectives.description: therapeutic (comparative more therapeutic, superlative most therapeutic)

entries.meaning: Having a positive effect on the body or mind.
examples: His music is very therapeutic when you listen to it.
